Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarketingDiva
Reviews.Content: I hate staying at those big hotels where you are lost in the shuffle. I always keep my eye out for boutique hotels, and let me tell you this hotel does not disappoint. I had a meeting in another city and had to take a ferry to get there and the staff went above and beyond to make sure that I was taken care of. They even called my business associate to make sure that I arrived safely. This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in, and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Setting standards in hospitality industry....”
Reviews.Author: Mumbaikirti
Reviews.Content: This is a truly lovely property with fantastic location,soothing interiors and serene ambience.We selected this hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor and we were not disappointed.Rooms are very nice with good internet connection.The service is excellent.This hotel has really put details in their service.All staff members are motivated, very helpful and attentive;delivering prompt service with extra attention and zeal. Hotel manager Ms Zeynep Korel is super efficient and very courteous.On learning that we were holidaying in Istanbul on occasion of our wedding anniversy,she got delivered complimentary bottle of fine wine to our room. Perhaps that is why saying goes that EXCELLENCE HAS A WAY IN SPEAKING FOR ITSELF....

Reviews.Title: “Fab luxe boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: simonrcurtiscel
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and have just spent 5 days at this great hotel. Would thoroughly recommend it for a stay in Istanbul. It is a lovely small hotel, with all the luxe ingredients to make a great stay - lovely clean quiet rooms, super comfy bed (although the teeny kids camp bed was a bit rickety!), fab bathroom, great breakfasts and really friendly helpful staff. Our kids probably emptied the hotel's stockroom of free chocolates too.......oh, and a great location close by to cool little cafes, restaurants, shops, parks, sightseeing etc. Stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “best of stylish Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: rodolfo3200
Reviews.Content: ARRIVAL: being used to The House Hotel Bosphorus hospitality in Summer, I had very high expectations for my arrival this time and they managed to surprise me. The Nisantasi branch of this wonderful hotel chain has a very welcoming feeling, if House Bosphorus is a relaxed quick experience, House Nisantasi is like having a trendy townhouse with best service. Even being from Brazil which is reasonably far I felt like home over there. STAFF: Everything is done in quick and efficient way, everybody from ground floor desk staff to front desk reception staff and bar is SO KIND and nice. I had a lot of attention from Mr. Fatih who gave me plenty of useful advice and told me about the hotel and the region, having even offered me the best capuccino I had in Istanbul until today. Like I said the treatment is very personal and welcoming, Ms. Senem, whose name I found out to mean "top of the world" really does make Istanbul feel like the top of any guests world because she has all advices and efficient suggestions for gastronomy, touring around the typically exclusive areas and once again the service excellence makes the guest feel comfortable and anxious to return to Istanbul. HOTEL/LOCATION: The location of House Nisantasi is prime, in the main street of this upscale shopping district where there are the most charming cafÃ©s of Istanbul and all the attention somebody can get, this is simply great. It is a very cool design hotel, mostly seemed useful for business people, young trendy people and couples, there isn't the common pool facilities that attract kids because the proposition of the hotel concept is more like a chic townhouse for jetsetters, anyway the prices are very reasonable, the room design is AWESOME and there is so much complimentary stuff... fantastic. Now they also have a spa on the top floor to which I didn't had time to book any treatment due to a busy business stay. OVERALL: The hotel is simply flawless, the breakfast usually included is delicious and the staff measures no efforts to make sure the guest is satisfied, which made it feel like 5 stars++ standard! Makes me say that next time I'll certainly return to the House Nisantasi on my upcoming business trip to town! And my congratulations to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kara_blanc
Reviews.Content: the hotel is really nice. you feel the quality in every thing: service, design, bed, breakfast, bathroom and etc. shower amenities are from l'occitane, coffee is nespresso. they didn't miss any thing! will be happy to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like we were home”
Reviews.Author: katerina k
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The House Hotel Nisantasi and we loved it. The architect, the location and the staff is great. Everybody was happy to serve us and they have a hotel manager zeynep Korel who has been very helpful. She takes care of each guest with smiles and great attitude. We can see she keeps it under control yet her staff is still very happy to work there, now that's the talent. We recommend it to everyone to stay and visit beautiful Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: monak5
Reviews.Content: i was there in may 2011, went there with two girlfriends, the hotel was excellent as near to everywhere, bazar, malls, sites...etc just for your info, they do have another sister hotel on the bosphoros in ortakoy, which is just as nice but only ortakoy is a bit far from the places to would probably go to like bazar, taksim, malls, historic site. nisantase is very chic and high end area, you will see some very classy turkish young trendy ppl. the room, you should choose the room with a terrace, which has a lovely balcony and you can see part of the bosphopros. very clean, the breakfast room was excellent with a good variety to choose from. room service, dont know, cos when i am in turkey, i rarely eat at the hotel, just breakfast, i eat out all the time cos i love turkish restrnts. Last i have to add that the manager, antony was great with us and helped us in everything, he went out of his way to make us comfortable. the only edge that nisantase house has on house ortakoy, is that i felt the room we stayed in was more comfortable and bigger and bigger balcony. the room in ortakoy house is a bit longish which was a bit tight for me. But overall, the chain is great and i do stay in them everytime i am in istanbul, thanks antony and team for your help during our stay at your hotel Mrs. Muna Bustani

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: yngwie m
Reviews.Content: i was very pleased from the hotel. clean room, nice stuff and of course the hotel manager mrs Zeynep Korel was always there to help us for anything we needed. i will stay again next time i visit istanbul. i recommend it to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: gg7786
Reviews.Content: Liked the location on one of the nicest shopping streets in Istanbul, the service was courteous, the breakfast buffet simplistic but delicious. The room was stylish with an eye on design and thankfully still functional which is not always the case with design hotels. I really enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish place to stay in a chic neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: DAZJakarta
Reviews.Content: From the moment I look into their website and observing all the photos posted with regards to this property, I knew that I was not making a wrong decision to stay here on the last leg of our Turkey trip. Having to deal with mediocre room the night before, this place is indeed a true heaven. To begin with, it is located in a very upscale part of Istanbul (Nisantasi), where you can rub shoulders with some of the chicest people in town. The hotel entrance is small, with lobby located on the second floor. Once you have reached the lobby, you will be totally wooed by the elegant a la Art Deco design. Smartly designed, warmth but not too overwhelming with too many decor elements. We were welcomed by a genuine smile of all staffs, ready to assist you in any way they can and to ensure that you are enjoying your time both at the hotel as well as the amazing Istanbul. Big extra point indeed ! They even going extra mile in preparing breakfast very early in the morning on our departure day to Athens. Something that we really appreciate. Don't forget to take the chocolate available on the reception desk, it's totally awesome ! The room is equally wonderful, smartly designed with a chic decor. Comfortable bed with a neatly designed bathroom, not too big but just in a right size. Breakfast food is good, too bad that we did not enjoy drinks or meal in their small restaurant next to the lobby which is rated quite high as well. It is located in a very upscale shopping district of Istanbul, where you can even directly jump into Prada boutique at the ground floor. It is a 30 minutes walk to the nearest tram station in Cabatas hence if you plan your sightseeing to the old part of Istanbul, this hotel may not be the most convenient choice. But I will surely choose this hotel for the luxury with a reasonable price tag attached to it. Highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “la beautiful boutique hotel in the center of the shopping district”
Reviews.Author: JeromeGoa
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful jewel. We stayed in a small suite with a private terrace overlooking the Bosphorus. The staff was the most helpful during our entire two stays. From the bell boys to the reception and the F&B staff, everyone wanted to make our stay memorable. Start your day with a small but excellent buffet breakfast, Turkish style with cheese, olives and delicacies. Lunch can be had at the House cafe in the next street. In the evening ample supply of ice, raki and Turkish mezze on our terrace. A great minibar with choice of wines by the bottle, great wine glasses. Confortable room with free WiFi. The place to be pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aggelaki89
Reviews.Content: It's a great boutique hotel in a great location. I stayed very satisfied! Very clean rooms,good stuff and great breakfast!! The Hotel Manager Zeynep Korel is very professional,she solves the problems quickly and her elegant attitude is everywhere you can see!It's like her own hotel and she takes care of everything herself! I will definately come again!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arnaki2
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, design wise as well as location wise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but hardest beds I ever slept on”
Reviews.Author: 1000worldtraveller
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul for business and my husband was joining me for the weekend, so I chose this hotel because of the location and the recommendations. The hotel in general looks great, service is excellent and everybody tries their best to provide everything you ask for. The breakfast buffet was delicious. I would have rated this as a fantastic hotel. Unfortunately the mattress were so thin that I couldn't sleep (it was like a hard sponge on top of a wooden plataform). I requested pillows to try to soften the pressure against my bones but it only helped a little. My husband also had a terrible sleep. We were so tired from not sleeping that we couldn't enjoy the visits as much as we should. Later I found out that in Turkey people like hard beds and that I can understand, but if this hotel is aiming for international tourists they should find a solution. For the rest this hotel was very charming, in great location and with excellent food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Hema R
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in one of the poshest locality of Istanbul, then this is the place..We stayed here from 26 to 31 December 2011..and we just loved staying here..the roads were all lit up for Newyear celebrations and the road was covered with red carpet...There r lots of lovely eating joints plus there is a mall nearby, which has a food court which offers more dining options. We however faced a bit of a problem getting taxis from Kabatas (nearby tram station) back to the room as the roads in Nisantasi get very crowded in the evenings and taxi drivers r reluctant to drive to that street... Otherwise an overall a great place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not business friendly”
Reviews.Author: kgdspd
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel situated in the "hippest" part of Istanbul with restaurants, clubs, cafes all around. The staff were very nice. The breakfast buffet is just ok. My biggest complaint is with the functionality of the room. There is no closet - just a small rack with hangers and 2 very tiny drawers so I lived out of my suitcase for 6 days. It's meant to be stylish not functional. I requested an iron twice but it never arrived. They only have one printer which is at the reception desk (which is on the 2nd floor) so the only way to print anything is to email it to the reception. The "business center" is one computer with no printer. I only traveled with my iPad so I was not able to print my boarding pass. Very disappointing in a hotel that is trying to be a 5-star luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: TouringTrick
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure from start to finish. From the Bellboy right through to the cleaning staff this hotel was such a great experience. On arrival I was upgraded and had a huge room with the most plush carpets and clever design. I never wanted to leave the hotel and felt quite sad everytime I walked out the door. The staff are amazing and charming and have excellent service. The background music during the day and at breakfast was perfectly chosen. Breakfast won top of my list for my entire stay in Turkey ( a tall order). The mini bar - substantial The only problems I experienced with my room was a strange spot on the carpet - like something had been spilled there previously and although substantial effort had been made to clean it up, it was the one thing that was out of place, that and the ipod docking station didnt work - after calling reception they advised they had no idea why it didnt work - but it wasnt a big problem due to all the other amazing features of the room. I loved the design of the hotel and was made to feel more than welcome to stay there... I only wish I could have stayed longer, but I might never have left. The hotel is reasonably close to public transport and travellers should be warned when taking a taxi from Taxim Square - it should cost you around 10TL at the most. My first taxi took full advantage and charged me 20TL - I was too tired to argue. On leaving the hotel, they concierge organised me a taxi at a decent and honest fare, so perhaps ask them to organise your pickup too. Loved the hotel and am thrilled to have stayed there

Reviews.Title: “This is where you want to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: norarashed
Reviews.Content: Hey all u hotel seekers, This is definitely the hotel you are looking for! If you are searching to stay in an upscale area with shops, restaurants and cafes all around. This is nisantaci. I just got back two days ago from a six night stay at this hotel. Simply six days of paradise and lesiure! We felt like royalty at the house hotel. From the minute we stepped in we felt the hospitality from the concierge to the front desk. The room is spacious and modern. The hotel is very well kept. All the staff speak English definite plus in turkey. And the amazing tulcay at the front desk was very helpful all the time, he gave us great advice from where to go, how to go, reservations you name it.. Will definitely stay here again and again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a upmarket area”
Reviews.Author: me1000uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in 2010. The area is not far from Taksim (although a fair walk/taxi away) and unless the weather is nice for a walk (maybe 20 mins or so) then I wouldn't say it's that great for public transport. Then again it is at the higher end, and the area is almost like Bond Street/Mayfair in London with plenty of high end designer shops nearby and some decent eateries. I would rate this hotel in the 4/5 star range, although the breakfast was very ordinery, the rooms were nice and there are always bonus points for the Nespresso machines in the room! Very comfortable to stay in this hotel, but perhaps better on repeated visits to istanbul and not the first time as the tourist sites aren't in this area, nor is the public transport something I would describe as local. No complaints about the room.

Reviews.Title: “elina”
Reviews.Author: elina z
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied from my 4 day stay to this cosy small hotel : friendly staff ,very nice decoration ,relaxing and quality, loved its breakfast...and the most important is that the hotel is situated in the best area to be : luxurious shops , nice restaurants ,cafes and bars to enjoy your vacation with in walking distance!and the price is reasonable . in conclusion this 5 stars hotel can be the best choice for a visitor and will be definitively mine, next time I visit Instanbul!

Reviews.Title: “NiÅŸantaÅŸÄ±”
Reviews.Author: AytuncSoytekin234
Reviews.Content: This is the most amazing place in Istanbul that you can spend days. A wonderful experience and one will be repeating. The service is just completely over the top, the Hotel manager Ms. Zeynep is a charming exceptional and professional. We will be back soon and often.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jale77
Reviews.Content: An overall wonderful experience! Everone was friendly, excellent location in the city, rooms were very well stocked and it was a "first class" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A noisy room!”
Reviews.Author: muffin00
Reviews.Content: We were supposedly 'upgraded' to a terrace room. We were suspicious from the start about this and this proved to be right. The terrace was nice but it was too cold to enjoy! We asked for a quiet, non smoking room and received a room with a dirty ashtray, next to the air conditioning unit for the building, that hummed and pumped all night. For nearly 400 E we expected better than this. Do not accept an upgrade to room 75!!

Reviews.Title: “Not good for business”
Reviews.Author: dhaigh
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot to Istanbul. Stayed here instead of the usual large 5 star hotels given all the good reviews. IN short was not happy and will not stay here again. Arrived at 10.30 pm, spent a good while waiting in the reception/breakfast room/bar to check in to a suite. When was checked in, looked for room service menu. Eventually called room service, was told at 1105, that room service stopped at 11. Unhelpful staff. Then asked for laundry service was told that this could not be done. Asked for ironing Board finally got it after calling for 4 times. Very noisy AC and TV was not working. Room was large Next morning went to breakfast, sat for 10 minutes before was asked what i would like, breakfast not impressive. Dont stay at this hotel if you are on business. Ok if you are on a weekend break. Best

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjgeno
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 nights at the House Hotel in Nisantasi, Istanbul. The rooms were all generous sized. Very clean. The staff was always very kind and made every attempt to meet your needs. It was a wonderful area of Istanbul, with easy access to the Tram or subway system. You are 20" tram ride from the old town area. If you have a street side room the restaurant/bar can be quite loud. But overall we would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Cute and Calm”
Reviews.Author: nasim n
Reviews.Content: My family and I greatly enjoyed staying in the House Hotel for 7 nights. What a wonderful location during the day and very Calm an peaceful at night time. Fantastic hospitality and gorgeous interior design. Well selected images in the reception area were so impressive. all the staff were extremely helpful and friendly and we had unforgettable week in Istanbul with our comfortable accommodation in House Hotel Nisantasi. Congratulations to its manager and director.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alan C
Reviews.Content: The House Hotel in Nisantasi, Istanbul, is after more than 30 years of worldwide travel one of best experiences I have had â€“ aesthetically pleasing, comfortable, and accommodating. A boutique hotel, it is situated in one of the more stylish inner city suburbs surrounded by brand clothing shops and chic restaurants. The staff were very friendly and courteous and the service excellentâ€“nothing that couldn't be done to make our stay more enjoyable. Breakfast was excellent each morning; the rooms expansive, quiet and comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel for people who want something stylish and smaller, quiet and differentâ€”away from the large impersonal hotel visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place Stayed In Europe”
Reviews.Author: lloydy64
Reviews.Content: Recently complete a 5 week stay in Europe, this hotel was by far the best based on style, service and location. We stayed for 5 nights in the Middle of August. Would recommend the Junior suite to all travellers. Staff are so accommodating and go out their way to make sure your stay is trouble free, this is from arranging tours to booking restaurants. Breakfast was great with a wide variety to choose from. Hotel is in a great location and lots of nice little restaurants. Will stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Designer Chic”
Reviews.Author: AdnanSyed
Reviews.Content: "Designer Chic" is probably the best phrase to describe this hotel. We wanted to check out the contemporary pulse of the city on this trip, having done all the typical touristy sightseeing tours on our previous visits to Istanbul... And this hotel was perhaps the best place to do so. Its located in a beautiful cobbled tree-shaded street in trendy Nisantasi and so all the chic shopping venues are just a short walk away. Stepping out of the hotel is ofcourse easy because everything is downhill and the walks are lovely especially down past the macka park. The hotel is beautifully outfitted with elegant furniture artfully scattered here and there. Our room was luxuriously large, with a host of little touches like chocolates on the pillow, the L'Occitane toiletries in the bathroom, the usual but unusually-well-stocked snack/beverage facilities in the room.... and a weird glassed in cupboard which was the only thing that took some getting used to. Ofcourse the wi-fi in the room never worked properly except in the first half-hour of our stay, and even though the staff was very polite and apologetic, it was never resolved satisfactorily while we were there. The other technical glitch we had to suffer through were the elevators conking out one day... We had no way of getting up to our room 5 floors up, and laden with shopping bags that isn't an easy task, especially when there isn't any staff on duty to help you! These personnel issues aside our stay was fantastic. The breakfast lounge was a lovely and sunny overlooking the street below and ofcourse the breakfast was to-die-for. Limited in variety, but really thoughtfully done. There were, surprisingly no International Newspapers, other than the single local English daily, and ofcourse numerous Turkish Dailies. There is a library in the lounge with and interesting collection of books (mostly English) which is perfect way to unwind... though who'd want to spend time indoors in a city like Istanbul?? The staff on duty tried to be helpful and usually were except with even slightly-more-complicated queries. However after a couple of days, the haute couture feel of the hotel began to grate on the nerves. The overly-styled ambience lacks a certain warmth: This beautifully styled hotel is almost like a piece of haute couture that's great to look at but not something one can wear for too long...

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: connected2space
Reviews.Content: I've found this hotel when I was looking for some place to stay in Istanbul and booked it immediately. It is located in a nice area with quite a few posh shops, from there you can walk through a park to DolmabahÃ§e Palace and Bosphorus. If it's not too hot you could try to walk to Taksim otherwise it's a few minutes by taxi. The area is a bit quieter which means your sleep won't be disturbed yet it's a popular area with many cafes around (including House Cafe in about 5min walk from the hotel). The Hotel itself has cool design, loved the lounge/breakfast area. Our room was spacious, there's enough storage, big bathroom, nice bed. The room was full of those little details that make hotel stay especially enjoyable - enough towels, fancy toiletries, chocolates on the pillows, free water everyday (a blessing in Istanbul) and even a little orchid on a bed table. If you're a Nespresso fan - take a few capsules of your favorite blend as they have a coffee machine in the room (some coffee provided by hotel). We were too lazy to use the gym on the top floor, but came over to take a look - it's rather on a small side but machines look newish, A/C and a view over the city though the glass walls. The service during our stay was excellent, hotel staff is very helpful and English-speaking. On our last day we had to leave very early and I wasn't sure if we'd have time to have breakfast, however the breakfast area was opened precisely on time and we had our meal before leaving to airport. The breakfast is very good and I am very peckish with my food, seasonal fruits (better than anything you tried in UK), eggs the way you'd prefer, cheese/meats/cereals etc. Freshly squeezed orange juice - I was surprised how many nice hotels in a orange-growing countries have compromised on that, so couldn't help having 2 glasses with every breakfast, greedy me. Oh and don't forget those mini chocolate brownies...yum... Overall I definitely recommend to stay at Nisantasi House Hotel and I am looking forward to stay there next time we'll be in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel manager”
Reviews.Author: kenevans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The House Hotel for 5 nights in early August. The hotel is in a fantastic location right in the heart of Nisantasi and walking to the Bosphorus and the tram to Saltanahmet. We stayed in the Terrace Junior Suite King - very spacious, huge terrace and lovely bathroom. Overall the room had a lovely feel and was very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was very good. The fresh fruit was delicious. The hotel manager, Zeynep, made the stay for us. She was very friendly and approachable and provided some great insider tips for Istanbul. We enjoyed chatting to Zeynep each day at breakfast and noticed that she provided similar personalised service to each of the hotel guests. We would definitely stay in the hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Cholito63
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful boutique hotel in the middle of Istanbul most exclusive shopping area, Nisantasi. It is about 20 minute walk from Taksim and about 45 minute taxi to Istanameh. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable, Contemporary look with modern bathrooms. Breakfast is wonderful!. The Manager, Zeynep, will help you with any questions you may have and give you her list of best restaurants and shopping in Istanbul. Highly recommended for couples or families with older kids (teens).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: khaled074
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice, very modern and well furnished!!! It's situated in the fanciest place of istanbul, close to all the chic stores! We were actually living in the Prada building. The staff was very courteous and the manager really gentle and helpful! The room was spacy, very comfy with a wonderful bathroom! We just had a wonderful stay in istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “I certainly enjoyed my stay at the House Hotel Nisantasi”
Reviews.Author: iraz00
Reviews.Content: The House Hotel Nisantasi was very welcoming with its helpful staff and very comfortable room. Its location was also very convenient for me, being in the middle of Istanbul's popular shopping area and 5 minute walk away from the tube station. I do recommend it strongly and I certainly will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccably Flawless”
Reviews.Author: Kyozaan
Reviews.Content: I chanced upon this gem in the heart of Istanbul & was I glad for it. From the moment you step in till the time you check out, there is nothing that can be faulted in this wonderful boutique hotel. The rooms are well appointed, staff is cheerful, helpful & forever smiling & it is delightfully located in the posh shopping district of Istanbul with a multitude of restaurants all around the hotel. All in all a great experience, highly recommended to my fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION & GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: richard777_999
Reviews.Content: For a business /shopping trip this is perhaps the best you can get. Access to fine casual and formal dining, wifi and the perfect breakfast. Staff are friendly and attentive and well spoken. The rooms and neat and clean and have access to the outside air which i treasure. Few subleties that work for me are the little chocolates freely avaialble in the lobby and the wonderful chairs and tables outside that become the people watching or cigar puffing setting after a dinner and stroll. The manager is also real and not a figment tucked away in some office. She is dynamic and engaging and will atttend to and redirect any query. Hassle free living !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent improvement since my last visit”
Reviews.Author: Aydus
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before but never enjoyed it as much as last may. I frequently come to stay in this part of the town but I was surprised to see the great improvements throughout the Hotel recently. The feminen touch and the warm welcome of all the staff was very impressive. I hope they keep it up and look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location super service!”
Reviews.Author: Taloli
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel location and relaxed vibe.. For serious shoppers a must destination.. The new hotel manager zeynep korel was lovely, helpful and all about guest comfort and happiness...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: rahulh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the middle of the shopping district, well situated and modern. Our stay right form the get go was handled extremely well and smoothly. Staff was friendly and proactive to help. Rooms are very well laid out, comfortable with a full complement of amenities. . Location is far from the Sultanahmet but the hotel is an oasis of calmness after the frenetic and bustle of the old city. recommend the hotel very highly and everyone visiting Istanbul should consider staying there

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PaulineSage
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last week and loved it. Friendly staff, wonderful interior, great choice at breakfast, and all the shops are at the hotel door! Very safe, modern, clean. Can't wait to be back on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: EvaSzabo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the House Hotel in Istanbul. I spent 4 nights here. I did not know the brand before but i would highly recommend it to everybody. The hotel is located in the best, safest location of Istanbul. I especially liked the design and the furniture. The hotel is very clean and the staff was very attentfull and kind. I would like to return on one day. Shopping is great in the area! There is a nice playground in the area, excellent place to stay for families with childern.

Reviews.Title: “A pearl in the heart of Nisantasi”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellingGabo
Reviews.Content: Despite being far from the touristic area (which is usually crowded an overrated) I would recommend this hotel to everybody. And Nisantasi is a great neighbourhood to be honest! Lovely service,terrific breakfast buffet,nice design rooms with stereo and iPhone plugs,big flat screen,huge shower. Only small flaw the wi-fi in my room didn't really work,but it was free anyway so I didn't bother complaining. This hotel is really cool :-)

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth IT-Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jmurrayolympic
Reviews.Content: 3 day stay-2 rooms over $400 room per night. Confused staff .Asked for a Steak restaurant-sent us to one which had NO steak. No hot water 2 mornings.No place to meet w/contacts. Mediocre breakfast. Rooms poorly designed-especially window panels which blocked thermostat. Broken door handle-2 days to fix.Internet often did not work. On busy shopping street w/upscale stores. No restaurant & no pool. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the trendy part of Istambul.”
Reviews.Author: Ziry
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, away from the caos of historical attractions and yet not far from. Best shopping street in town. Modern decor and design, rooms are average for this kind of hotel. Service tries hard to be trendy and fashion but theyÂ´re not, donÂ´t speak much english and could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jedialex65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the House Hotel over the Easter Weekend. The hotel was everything we expected and more. Great location, helpfull staff, clean rooms, great food, excellent rooms. We have been to Istanbul several times and always preferred the international chains. After getting a tip from a friend I choose this hotel and it was worth it. I will definately stay there again when visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and good service”
Reviews.Author: brizzagirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a great deal from Mr and Mrs Smith, we booked a junior suite. Lovely room with very comfortable bed, modern boutique decor and very funky. The staff were really helpful, especially for restaurant recommendations and getting around. The area is lovely and we were surprised about how much there was around the hotel (lovely shops!) and also it was livelier at night than we were expecting. Just a couple of minor points, on location it was not that easy to get to the main sights as it is north of the central "touristy" area, so it involves either a cab ride to the tram station then tram or metro, or a cab ride all the way in. I would say it takes about 30 mins to get to Sultanahmet and it is not walkable. Also we felt there was a bit of a lack of attention to detail, the bathroom toiletries and even paper were not replenished. The breakfast was lovely with lots of choice but you had to ask for juice and for them to refill croissant basket, bowls and plates etc when this should be noticed and dealt with at this kind of place. But we really enjoyed our stay and would have given it a 5 if the minor details had been sorted out!

HotelInfo.Name: The House Hotel Nisantasi
HotelInfo.Address: Abdi Ipekci Cd. No:34 Nisantasi Sisli, Istanbul 34367, Turkey
